abstract: Nebraska Supreme Court ruling paves way for construction of Keystone XL oil pipeline and House vote of 266 to 153 to approve project puts added pressure on Pres Obama to make decision; Obama had said he would not take action until state court weighed in; State Department has official authority to permit project, but final decision rests with Obama.
lead_paragraph: After the Nebraska Supreme Court cleared the way for construction of the Keystone XL pipeline, the House voted, 266 to 153, approving of the project.

byline.contributor: Coral Davenport reported from Washington, and Mitch Smith from Chicago. Adam Liptak contributed reporting from Washington, and David Anderson from Omaha.
byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and MITCH SMITH

snippet: After the Nebraska Supreme Court cleared the way for construction of the Keystone XL pipeline, the House voted, 266 to 153, approving of the project.

headline.main: Obama Facing Rising Pressure on Keystone Oil Pipeline
headline.print_headline: Obama Facing Rising Pressure on Oil Pipeline
